choices.B: Report Definition Activity in Automation Studio
choices.A: File Transfer Activity in Automation Studio

questions.question_text:
A marketing team wants to schedule automatic delivery of Datorama pivot table data to an Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3 bucket every Monday at 6:00 a.m.

Which method meets their needs?

A marketing manager wants to see how the cross-channel customer population has changed over the last 6 months.

Which report should be run to provide this information?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To see how the cross-channel customer population has changed over the last 6 months, the marketing manager should run the Contacts Count report. This report provides insights into the number of contacts over a specified period, helping to track changes in the customer population.
So, the correct report to run is:
• A. Contacts Count

Selected Answer: B
Forgot to submit B

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) wants to include specific content for its most engaged customers and different content for its least engaged customers.

Which Journey Builder activity should NTO use?

comments.content: I mean't to say for B you CANNOT filter by descriptions.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C. Tags Content Builder nested tags provide the ability to filter when searching for tagged content. (https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=mktg.mc_ceb_nested_tags.htm&type=5)
A - Folders help organize content but don't specifically improve filtering (which is the problem statement of this question).
B- You can filter by descriptions.

questions.question_text:
A marketer wants to enable better filtering of their assets in Content Builder.

What is the best approach to do this?

choices.A: Add assets to folders upon creation.
choices.C: Add descriptive tags to each asset upon creation.
choices.B: Add a description to each asset upon creation.

questions.question_text:
A global marketing team has created an email using Content Builder Approvals and shared it with multiple business units in their Enterprise. Even though the email was approved, additional changes are needed.

What is the first action that should be taken to make the edits?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To make additional changes to an approved email in Content Builder, the first action that should be taken is to update the email approval status. This involves changing the status from "Approved" to "Draft" or another editable status, which will allow the necessary edits to be made.
So, the correct first action is:
• C. Update email approval status.

Selected Answer: A
should be A based on documentation:
"To withdraw a shared email, unshare the email first, and then withdraw it from Approvals. Unsharing the email deletes all copies from other business units."
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_ceb_approvals_considerations.htm&type=5
